title: How to Make Kabsa

steps.headline: After 3 tablespoons of olive oil is warmed in the pot, add the chopped onions.
steps.description: Sauté till they turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Grate the tomatoes using a cheese grater and add it to the pot along with the kabsa spice.
steps.description: Stir the mixture for 5 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Add in the cooked rice slowly and mix well until the white rice turns slightly yellow.
In the second pot add 2 cups of water, chicken strips and 2 tablespoon (29.6 ml) olive oil and bring to a boil for 15 minutes.
While the chicken is boiling, mix together 1 can tomato paste, 1 cup of water, and the 7 spice mixture in the mixing bowl.
After the chicken has boiled for 15 minutes, strain the water and transfer the chicken to the bowl.
steps.description: Mix well until the chicken is well coated with tomato paste.

steps.headline: Place all the nuts on a baking sheet and roast it in the oven at 275°F (135°C) for 10-15 minutes.
Combine the chicken, rice and add salt to taste.
Top with roasted nuts as garnish.
Serve hot with cool plain yogurt.

text: The Rice After 3 tablespoons of olive oil is warmed in the pot, add the chopped onions. Sauté till they turn golden brown. Grate the tomatoes using a cheese grater and add it to the pot along with the kabsa spice. Stir the mixture for 5 to 10 minutes. Add in the cooked rice slowly and mix well until the white rice turns slightly yellow. Set rice aside. The Chicken: In the second pot add 2 cups of water, chicken strips and 2 tablespoon (29.6 ml) olive oil and bring to a boil for 15 minutes.  While the chicken is boiling, mix together 1 can tomato paste, 1 cup of water, and the 7 spice mixture in the mixing bowl.  After the chicken has boiled for 15 minutes, strain the water and transfer the chicken to the bowl. Mix well until the chicken is well coated with tomato paste. Together: Place all the nuts on a baking sheet and roast it in the oven at 275°F (135°C) for 10-15 minutes.  Combine the chicken, rice and add salt to taste.  Top with roasted nuts as garnish.  Serve hot with cool plain yogurt.
